title: General Motors strike to hit U.S. October payrolls
text:
General Motors strike to hit U.S. October payrolls

Economic Indicators 26 minutes ago (Oct 25, 2019 11:36AM ET)

WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A strike by General Motors (N: ) will likely cut at least 46,000 jobs from October's nonfarm payrolls, a Labor Department report showed on Friday. The department’s monthly strike report showed a total of 46,000 General Motors employees were idle during the survey period of the October payrolls count. Striking workers who do not receive a paycheck during the reference for period are treated as unemployed. The government will publish its closely watched employment report for October on Nov. 1.

General Motors strike to hit U.S. October payrolls
description: General Motors strike to hit U.S. October payrolls
